definitions.text: a self-contained part of a larger composition (written or musical)
examples: he always turns first to the business section
the history of this work is discussed in the next section

definitions.text: a very thin slice (of tissue or mineral or other substance) for examination under a microscope
examples: sections from the left ventricle showed diseased tissue

definitions.text: a distinct region or subdivision of a territorial or political area or community or group of people
examples: no section of the nation is more ardent than the South
there are three synagogues in the Jewish section

definitions.text: one of several parts or pieces that fit with others to constitute a whole object
examples: a section of a fishing rod
metal sections were used below ground
finished the final segment of the road

definitions.text: a small team of policemen working as part of a police platoon
one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole
examples: the written part of the exam
the finance section of the company

definitions.text: a land unit equal to 1 square mile
(geometry) the area created by a plane cutting through a solid
a small class of students who are part of a larger course but are taught separately
examples: a graduate student taught sections for the professor's lecture course

definitions.text: a division of an orchestra containing all instruments of the same class
a small army unit usually having a special function
a specialized division of a large organization
examples: you'll find it in the hardware department
she got a job in the historical section of the Treasury

definitions.text: a segment of a citrus fruit
examples: he ate a section of the orange

definitions.text: the cutting of or into body tissues or organs (especially by a surgeon as part of an operation)
